titleStmt.title: James Prentis to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1787

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Lewisport, Ky Feb 28 64
To his excellency the Gov of Kentucky
Sir

About a week past I sent in to the County Judge of this (Hancock) County, my resignation of Justice of the peace for this precinct. I was under an impression then that an Election would be held immediately to supply my place.

Since then I percieve that a temporary appointment untill May is your duty I beg leave therefore if an appointment has not yet been made, to recommend Mr. Eli ^E^ Gabbert as person for the position. He is a man of unimpeachable loyalty & fully competent.
I fully concur in the above recommendation.

Caldwell
Hancock Co
J. P
Apptd
4th Mar/64
